title: Pride & Prejudice (7/10) Movie CLIP - A Letter to Elizabeth (2005) HD

comments.author: MrFrancisco1987

comments.text:
I think the main concept is that Elazabeth believed the lies about Darcy 
rather than him. If it wasn't for his letter that explained the whole 
picture, Elazabeth would not have understood, and that he acted properly. 
Darcy may have changed, but we all change in our lives. I have gone through 
(and still am going through) a situation about some half truths that were 
said about me. This girl chose to believe the lies rather than my heart. 
This hurt me more than any other event in my life.
comments.author: David Quinn

comments.text: Eh. To each their own, I suppose.
comments.author: disneyjunkie19

comments.text:
disneyjunkie, not everyone has that specific character. I don't get why so 
many women are swooning over this Darcy character. He just overshadows 
other men in the novel and the film, making him the obvious "knight in 
shining armor". Also, men like Wickham and Collins are clearly and 
deliberately portrayed as undesirable. If you think about it, 
characterization is clearly romanticized. His niceness is a bit too 
deliberate for me.
comments.author: Tatum Davis

comments.text:
But he changes. And it took a specific character to let the world see that 
change. Lizzie got her happily ever after. She had to fight for it, and she 
made mistakes, but she did get it. Girls want that too. Plus, the guy who 
plays Darcy did a good job. And he's not bad to look at, from a female's 
perspective.
comments.author: disneyjunkie19
